identificationModule.briefTitle: Gemcitabine or Gemcitabine Plus Docetaxel After Cisplatin, Etoposide and Radiation in Non Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Randomized Study of Gemcitabine Plus Docetaxel After Cisplatin, Etoposide and Radiation Therapy in Stage III Unresectable NSCLC

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To assess the 2 year survival of patients with Stage III unresectable non-small cell lung cancer receiving consolidation gemcitabine or gemcitabine plus docetaxel following concurrent chemotherapy and radiation.

interventions.name: gemcitabine
interventions.description: After induction chemotherapy, radiation therapy and 10 weeks with no disease progression, randomized consolidation treatment begins. In both treatment arms, gemcitabine 1000 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2), is administered intravenously (IV), on days 1 and 8 of every 21-day cycle for 3 cycles.

interventions.name: docetaxel
interventions.description: Following cisplatin-etoposide induction chemotherapy, radiation therapy and 10 weeks with no disease progression, randomized consolidation treatment begins. In this treatment arm, docetaxel 75 mg/m2, is administered IV on day 1 of each 21-day cycle for 3 cycles. Docetaxel is given after gemcitabine.

interventions.name: cisplatin
interventions.description: As part of induction chemotherapy, cisplatin is given 50 mg/m2, IV, day 1, 8, 29 and 36 (spans 2 cycles)

interventions.name: etoposide
interventions.description: As part of induction chemotherapy, etoposide is given 50 mg/m2, IV, days 1-5 and 29-33 (spans 2 cycles)

interventions.name: radiation therapy
interventions.description: In conjunction with induction chemotherapy, radiation therapy is administered at a dose of 200 centi Gray (cGy) per day, Monday through Friday for 6 weeks

primaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of participants alive at 2 years.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Patients With Overall Tumor Response
secondaryOutcomes.description: Response was defined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria: Complete Response (CR)=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response (PR) =30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease (PD) =20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease (SD)=small changes that do not meet above criteria. The total number of CRs plus PRs equals overall response rate (ORR).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: randomization and every 3 months up to 2 years of post-study followup

secondaryOutcomes.description: Defined as the time from randomization into consolidation treatment to the first date of documented disease progression or death. Progression-free survival time was censored at the date of the last follow-up visit at which disease was assessed for patients who were still alive and who had not progressed.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline to measured progressive disease up to 2057 days

secondaryOutcomes.description: Overall survival is the duration from enrollment to death from any cause. For patients who are alive, overall survival is censored at the last contact.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline to date of death from any cause up to 2057 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Lung Cancer Symptom Scale (LCSS) Assessment Post-randomization
secondaryOutcomes.description: LCSS measures physical \& functional dimensions. The patient scale contains 9 items, 3 summation \& 6 symptom items. Each item is marked on a visual analog scale (0=low; 100=high). The mean of the 6 symptoms is used to calculate the average symptom burden index (ASBI). Improved=mean ASBI assessments from any 2 consecutive improved post-randomization assessments was at least 0.5 standard deviation (SD) below pre-randomization ASBI; worse=mean ASBI from any 2 consecutive post-randomization assessments was at least 0.5 SD above pre-randomization ASBI; stable=criteria for improved/worse not met.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline to 3 months after last dose of study treatment (three 21-day cycles)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* histologic or cytologic proof of single primary non-small cell lung cancer
* No prior chemotherapy or radiation therapy
* no prior malignancy

Exclusion Criteria:

* pregnancy or breastfeeding
* serious concomitant systemic disorder
* unintentional weight loss greater than 10%

groups.title: Gemcitabine
groups.description: Consolidation Treatment: gemcitabine 1000 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2), is administered intravenously (IV), on days 1 and 8 of every 21-day cycle for 3 cycles

groups.title: Gemcitabine Plus Docetaxel
groups.description: Consolidation Treatment: gemcitabine 1000 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2), is administered intravenously (IV), on days 1 and 8 of every 21-day cycle for 3 cycles; docetaxel 75 mg/m2, is administered IV on day 1 of each 21-day cycle for 3 cycles. Docetaxel is given after gemcitabine.

groups.title: Gemcitabine
groups.description: Consolidation Treatment: gemcitabine 1000 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2), is administered intravenously (IV), on days 1 and 8 of every 21-day cycle for 3 cycles

Docetaxel is given after gemcitabine.

measures.title: Race/Ethnicity, Customized
measures.description: breakdown of participants by ethnic origin

measures.title: Eastern Oncology Cooperative Group (ECOG) Performance Status
measures.description: Classifies patients according to their functional impairment. Scores range from 0 (Fully Active) to 5 (Death).

outcomeMeasures.title: 2-Year Survival
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage of participants alive at 2 years.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Patients With Overall Tumor Response
outcomeMeasures.description: Response was defined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria: Complete Response (CR)=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response (PR) =30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease (PD) =20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease (SD)=small changes that do not meet above criteria. The total number of CRs plus PRs equals overall response rate (ORR).
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: randomization and every 3 months up to 2 years of post-study followup

outcomeMeasures.title: Progression-Free Survival
outcomeMeasures.description: Defined as the time from randomization into consolidation treatment to the first date of documented disease progression or death. Progression-free survival time was censored at the date of the last follow-up visit at which disease was assessed for patients who were still alive and who had not progressed.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: baseline to measured progressive disease up to 2057 days

outcomeMeasures.description: LCSS measures physical \& functional dimensions. The patient scale contains 9 items, 3 summation \& 6 symptom items. Each item is marked on a visual analog scale (0=low; 100=high). The mean of the 6 symptoms is used to calculate the average symptom burden index (ASBI). Improved=mean ASBI assessments from any 2 consecutive improved post-randomization assessments was at least 0.5 standard deviation (SD) below pre-randomization ASBI; worse=mean ASBI from any 2 consecutive post-randomization assessments was at least 0.5 SD above pre-randomization ASBI; stable=criteria for improved/worse not met.
